title: Great little set
review: This was a great set. All those minifigs who were standing in line to get an ice-cream. When I bought the Shell shop from 1999, it had 2 real ice-cream pieces which I have put in the little fridge.

author: trentmelb
title: Ice-Cream.... yes please!
review:
Well I've just rebuilt this adorable little set from 1984. I remember loving this set as a kid and hopefully business is going to be just as good for him in 2011 and beyond.
I have him set up as per the front of the box so he can wheel his cart around town and meet the demands of the lunch hour or afternoon rush home near the train station.

Overall a simple little set that I find very charming and a great little 'detail' filler for your city.

author: CamberbrickGreen
title: Make Mine A 99
review:
I was tempted, over enthusiastically to rate this five bricks, but felt that such scores are reserved for the stand out masterpieces where as this is a favourite but extremely good for its small size and so remarkably rates a four.

Minifigures:
  • Colour coordinated red cap, blue trousers, white jacket print with red scarf: smart!
Cool Customer
This smart ice cream seller possesses a cart that has excellent red curved stripe tiles to attract any hot and thirsty minifigures to purchase some ice cream. Double red taps are set for delivering some whippy ice cream action and with the opening cart top that makes far too much excitement for such a small set. The only lacking thing in this fun little build is some choc ice or ice cream representative bricks- difficult at the time but something would have been good, unless I can not remember whats in the cart?

I'm sure if the ice cream seller delved in to grab ice cream that my brother's character would steal from the taps and vice versa. This sort of bad minifigure behaviour was typical on our layouts and designed to bait the cops. Stealing ice cream, gulp, may have justified blue lights and sirens! Being goaded to break up such sets was what led to the red and white tiles being worn down - ouch. Try and find a set with a good stripey print.

So, a really neat little set and an enterprise worth expanding upon with a van. What you mean there's never been a Lego ice cream van?! Well not unless you want an ice cream from 'The Joker'?

This is the best ice cream set to date because:
http://www.brickset.com/detail/?Set=2885-1
seems more interested in raking the money in!

author: Niki124
title: Going out on a high
review:
This was the last Lego set I bought for myself, just before I reached the age when I decided I'd rather spend money on cheap earrings from Clockhouse at C & A instead. Looking back, I went out on a moderate high.

I was impressed by the detail, the baseball cap, the taps, the parasol, and it was nice to see an ice lolly printed brick to give a link back to my much-loved Snack Bar. Once again this was another small set with just enough brick variety to have a go at making your own designs, but the neatness of the original design means this is the one which lasts. The swivel footstand is a neat touch, and meant that instead of having to run to keep up with the other vehicles on our Lego carpet convoys, the ice cream cart and its proprietor could simply affix themselves on top of the petrol tanker (as one obviously would).
